1.content:
In order to maximize the freedom of the story, there will be several different characters to serve as , "You" for this story. Character Bios will be listed here. No matter which character you chose, the story should always be told in second person, (ex. You open the door. You see a cat waiting for you.) as if the reader was actually the character. It's encouraged to try out all the characters, regardless of gender. Each character is designed with a different personality and setting in mind, while still leaving the future pretty open to write about.


Characters

Mark: Mark is a sophomore in high school, and a pretty normal, average guy. He plays football, has a girlfriend named Brit and he's an only child, and both of his parents are together. His hair is short and brown, his eyes are green and he's slightly muscular.

Lira: Lira is a 14 year old girl, who's been kidnapped by a monster who lived near the village, and locked in his castle until the ransom money arrives. She has a brother who's off wandering, and a father who's a poor tailor. She's short, blond, red eyed, and frail.

Dante: Dante is a knight in the service of King Vaughn. After witnessing the King murder his wife, he was immediately locked up, just in case he decided to talk. After seven years in his cell, he and a friend, Eduard whom he met inside, have just managed to escape. He has black hair, brown eyes, and stands tall. He's very muscular, and a skilled fighter.
1.title: Characters

11.content:
You blast the door open with a kick, and escape your daily prison. "I hate this school." You mutter as you walk to your car, freshmen passing you as they run to the bus. You walk through the parking lot swiftly, getting to your car, and zooming from the school before the buses begin to leave, trapping you behind them.

A few miles down the road, you pull over to the side of the road. Your girlfriend was going to meet you at this spot. While waiting, you blast the radio. When she finally appears around the corner, you turn down the volume completely, and open the door to let her in. "Where do you want to go?"

"Can we go to my Uncle's place? I need to talk to him about my dad." Brit says, rolling down the window.

"Sure.

When you get to her house, you both go inside. You all spend some time catching up, until the subject of Brit's father comes up. The two decide to go outside and talk in private. Her uncle invites you to help yourself to anything in the kitchen while you wait.

You search around, and don't find much. While taking a soda from the fridge, you notice a bowl of fruit pushed to the back. You reach in and grab a few pieces of the assorted fruit. Each one is tagged with a word. Flight, Time, Animal, and Human. There are more in the bowl. Which will you eat?
11.title: Mark

112.content:
You take the "Time" fruit from the bowl and eat it quickly. It doesn't sit well with your stomach.

After eating the fruit, you get increasingly bored. Brit is taking forever, and you really want to leave. You wish time would pass- You're at your home, lying on your bed. "Huh?" you say, as you lean up. It's 2:34 AM. Somehow you skipped over the past few hours of your life. You wonder what happened that-

You're back in the kitchen. You look at the clock on the wall. It's an hour after you ate the fruit. "The Fruit!" you blert out. You ate the "Time" fruit. That must have somehow given you the power to control the flow of time!
112.title: Time

1121.content:
'The Future...' You think. What's in store for you later in life? You close your eyes, as time begins to rush past you.

"I hate this job..." you hear a young woman mutter to your right. You open your eyes. You're in a hospital room. The woman you heard was a nurse. Pain is covering your body, and you any time you try to move, the pain triples.

You look at your hand. It's old, wrinkled, and covered in brown spots. You must have rushed forward to your elderly years. You must be 80 years into the future! The technology today must be amazing! You need to get out of this bed and see the new world. You climb from the bed, and put all your weight on your legs. It feels like they're going to shatter to a million pieces. There's some kind of cybernetic wheel chair next to the bed.
1121.title: The Future

11213.content:
You can't control these new powers too well, and you absolutely must get out of this hospital. You sit down in the chair next to the bed, and relax. It feels good to sit.

Without warning, something pierces your skin, and enters your back. It crawls underneath your skin, and goes your neck, until you feel it in your head. "What was that?" you think.

"I am SC-021: Your personalized Elder Maintenance Device." says a voice in the back of your head. You jump. You want to get out of here!

The chair zips forward, and starts maneuvering out of the room as easilly if you were walking. You can control the chair like legs. It must have synchronized with your brain.

"Are you checking yourself out?" says the voice again.

"Yes." you reply to it. A red light behind you blinks a few times, and then stops. As you reach the automatic doors leading out of the hospital, a television type thing displays a farewell.

You reach the outside. Surprisingly... It looks just like the world did before you skipped forward, but with futuristic accents. A silver trolley pulls up to the sidewalk, and displays a similar greeting. It must have come to pick you up.
11213.title: SC-021

112132.content:
You decide that it would be better to stay in the wheelchair. The trolly as if sensing your intentions drives down the road disappearing behind a few cars, all of which seemed to be driving themselves. You soon realize that technology in the future has advanced to such a high degree that people no longer need to drive cars. You look around your surroundings and see other advancements when it comes to technology, advancements like holograms resting on top, or on the side of buildings, all with a different image. Their were also children riding hover boards, that hovered only a few feet off the ground. You even saw a few robots assisting and aiding people throughout their day. The future has changed a great deal.

You, still sitting on the wheelchair decide to take a slow ride down the sidewalk. You looked amazed for a number of reasons, one you couldn’t believe that you where in the future, two you couldn’t believe that you could time travel, and three, you where amazed at the advancements the future made over the years. Honestly all these surprises could kill a old man, which you now where.

“Master, May I ask the reason, you have decided to expose yourself to the contaminated outside air, instead of staying in bed for much need rest?” You hear SC-021 ask.

“Oh, I just need some fresh air SC-021, staying in bed all day isn’t a good thing you know.” You say trying to come up with a good excuse.

“I seem so you going outside will help you feel better?” SC-021 asks

“Yes, of course it will.” You say with a little old man laugh, that kind of reminded you of you grandpas laugh.

“I see than proceed.” SC-021 says before going quite.

While riding the wheelchair down the sidewalk you see a man leaning against a wall reading a news paper. The man had no hair and looked to be somewhere in his 60s, he had on a brown jacket with a green shirt underneath, he also whore tan khaki pants with black shoes.

“Oh they still have newspapers in this era?” You ask

“Of course master.” SC-021 says.

You still looking at the man, sees that the man wore a angry look as he looked at the newspaper, you wondered why. The wheelchair responding to your thoughts goes over to the man.

“Mourning.” You say

The man looks at you and his anger seemed to melt away, replace by a genial smile.

“Mourning sir.” The man says.

“Might I inquire what’s got you so angry my good man?” You ask trying to sound as old as you could.

“Oh it’s really nothing, I was just reading about how their was another conduit found in Mexico, a few days ago.” The man said returning his gaze to his paper.

“Conduit? What are you talking about sonny?” You ask.

“You know a conduit. A person with super powered abilities.” The man said, looking at you a little weird.

“Oh of course a conduit, sorry my memory isn’t what it use to be.” You say, pretending to understand what the man was talking about, but in truth you had no idea.

“Oh it ok, or happens to the best of us.” The man says with a little laugh.

“Well I don’t know about you old timer, but I for one am tired of this conduit business. I say just dump them all on island X and be down with it already.” The man said balling up his newspaper and throwing in the trash.

“Right I’m with you, I’m sick of these conduits as well, island X to every last on of them.” You say still pretending to know what the man was talking about.

You didn’t know what this island X was, but you where going to find out.

“Well I should get going, I have old man things to do.” You say, the wheelchair turning around and moving away from the man.

“Of, of course it was good talking to you old timer.” The man says waving good bye.

You decide to go back to the hospital, on the way you decide to get answers.

“SC-021 what the hell is a conduit?” You ask

“A conduit is a person that has the ability to willed supernatural power, master.” You hear SC-021 say in your mind.

“Where do these conduits come from?” You ask.

“Conduits are born, when a human eats Ambrosia.” SC-021 says.

“What the hell is Ambrosia?” You ask getting only more confused.

“Ambrosia is a special fruit that when eaten gives some people strange abilities or in some cases kills them, master.” SC-021 says

You at that moment thought back to the fruit you ate at the house. You remembered how the fruit had tasted funny, the weird feeling it gave your stomach. You knew without a shadow of a doubt that, that fruit must have been Ambrosia. And sense it didn’t kill you, thank god, it gave you powers. The power to time travel.

“SC-021 please tell me what is island X?” You ask.

“Island X is the location that all Conduits go to live out the rest of their days. Located in the middle of the Pacific Ocean, master.” SC-021

“Why are conduits sent to live there, sense when?” You ask shocked by the news SC-021 revealed to you.

“Ever sense the Conduit War master.”

“What, what is the conduit war?” You ask a little scared of the answer.

“The Conduit War was the biggest war in history between conduits and human beings. It all started when a small group of terrorists threatened the United Nations. That small grew continued to grow until a hole army of conduits declared war on the world.” SC-021 says.

You wanted to cry, was this your future, war.

“A treaty was finally formed between the conduits and the humans after a great loss of life, the conduits would have their own island to do with as they please, but the only condition was that no conduit could leave that island, and in return no human would interfere with the conduits. The conduits would be free to go about their lives in peace. This agreement is called the superpower accords” SC-021 says.

“Bullshit, the conduits are fine with that stupid deal?” You asked.

“Their is a faction that disagrees with the accords, they call themselves the rebellion, they devote themselves to causing trouble for humans and conduits everywhere, and then their are the Conduits that awaken later on, and are forced to move to the island. The system even though flawed still works.” SC-021 Says.

“I don’t think it does.” You say with defiance.

“This situation was best for everyone, especially for the conduits. Before the war had ended, humanity had pushed the conduit raise to the brink of extinction, their are very few conduits left alive, only a few thousand, master.” SC-021 says.

You couldn’t believe it, it was more like you didn’t want to believe it. So many things have happened, so many lives lost.

“I have to go back and stop this.” You say with conviction.

“At any cost necessary.” You concentrate on your time period, and with a flash you return to your bed laying down as if nothing had ever happened.

You had a lot of things you needed to do, you had a war to stop after all.
112132.title: Continue by wheelchair

1122.content: Life has become so much more complicated as you've grown older. Sure, you've recieved more responsibilities, but that's exactly what they are: responsibilities. You don't want them. You just want to go back. How far?
1122.title: Go back in time

11221.content:
Screw it all. You don't want to do a thing. You want everyone to take care of you. You want to be able to do anything, and get off free because "You don't know any better." You want to be a baby again.

You open your eyes, and stare up at the ceiling. Tall white bars shoot up high above you. Stuffed animals crowd your crib. You've done it! You're a baby again! You hold your blanket close to you. You remember this thing. You always loved it as a baby. Then one day your mom threw it away. It feels so good to cuddle with it again.

Suddenly, your butt becomes heavy, and you feel something forcing it's way out. You try to hold it, but to no avail. You grab the papery white diaper covering your butt. You forgot about this part of being a baby. You see the baby monitor strapped to the side of the crib. If you start to cry, maybe your mom will bring you to the bathroom.
11221.title: Back to the begining

114.content:
You take the "Human" fruit from the bowl and eat it quickly. It doesn't sit well with your stomach.

"Come on, Mark, Let's go," Brit says, dragging you out by the arm. Her uncle must have said something that offended her. Out in the car, she lights up a smoke. "I hate that asshole. Did you know he forced my cousin to lie about my dad during his trial? She's EIGHT!"

You think about Stacy, that sweet innocent little girl, committing perjury in court because her father told her to. It was so sad. It made you want to- "The Road!" You lost sight of it. The dashboard has creeped up and blocked your field of vision. You reach for the breaks, but they're too far away! What's going on?

"Stacy?" You hear right before the car goes down a hill and slams into a tree. Before you black out, you're filled with concern. For who?
114.title: Human

1142.content:
Several days later, you wake up in the hospital. You're told that you drove the car into a tree, and were knocked out. You can't muster the strength to ask about Brit, so you just assume she's fine.

The doctors tell you that you'll be able to go home soon. They leave the news on, and some people begin to prepare you for the trip.

"The girl who crashed on 44 woke up today, " The newswoman reports. You're relieved. Brit is fine. "However, her boyfriend who was the owner of the car has not been found. It's believed he was shot through the windshield of the car, and may have rolled into the creek nearby the crash scene."

You stare in the TV in shock. Brit's OK, but you... are missing? The TV displays your picture, along with a phone number to call if anyone has information regarding you. You begin to panic, shaking the bed around, and causing a lot of noise. A doctor injects you with something to knock you out.

When you wake up, you're in Brit's bedroom. You're capable of moving now, and you get up. You grab your forehead and think about what you know. Before the car crashed you were thinking of Stacy. Suddenly, you were too small to drive and crashed. You were worried about Brit when you passed out... You grab your chest... And now you ARE Brit. The real Brit must have been flung from the car, and they assumed you were the one who disapeared, because "Brit" was still in the car.

Apparently, you have picked up the ability to transform. Related to that fruit you ate?
1142.title: Brit

choices: You come up with another plan
11421.content: You immediately return to the scene where you had crashed, looking for Brit's body. You eventually found her, and, after checking her breathing, you found she was still alive, but very cold. You struggled to lift her, until you thought about yourself, with a stronger body, and then managed to lift Brit. Looking down at yourself, you realised you had turned back. You carried Brit to the side of the road, and dialled an ambulance on your mobile. After you had hung up, you realised what you had done. You, as Brit, had been taken to hospital. 'Brit' had been discharged, and her boyfriend was still missing. The news reporters would have a field day if they found out about your ability. Still, if Brit didn't get help, she would die. You decided to wait with her, and make up some story for the reporters.

12.content:
“You can go anywhere in the castle, but don’t even think about leaving!” the creature barks at you as he chains up the front gate. “As soon as the money comes, you’ll be out of here!” The beast cracks your shackles with one swift slash of his claw, and drags you inside by a tight hold on your wrist.

Soon, the creature retreats into the basement, and locks the door tightly behind him, leaving you alone in the main hall of the castle. This kind of reminds you of that old fairy tale.

You decide to look upstairs, and climb the large staircase in the middle of the room. The halls upstairs are bare, mostly empty bedrooms that hadn’t been used in years. Thinking back to that old fairytale, you wonder how such a creature could have come into possession of a castle like this. After scouring the hallways, you go to return downstairs, and find that there’s a second staircase next to the one you came up. You didn’t notice it before. Unlike the first, which is large, wide, and draped in a red carpet; this one is tight, stone, steep, dirty, and winded up and up a tower. You hold your ragged dress up over your knees so you can run up the seemingly endless flight of stairs as quickly as possible.

Once you reach the top, you’re stunned to see a glowing, green light. The walls are covered in a green, emerald-like substance that was reflection light from somewhere. The room is almost empty, except for a small pedestal in the center, with a crystal atop it, covered in a glass case. Additionally, the walls are almost bare, except for small indents around the perimeter of the room. Each houses a small fruit inside, and there are nameplates below, possibly naming the fruit, or describing it somehow. A single indent had no fruit, but instead, an empty stand. The plate beneath it reads “Strength.”

Your stomach begins to growl. This fruit all looks so delicious, and you haven’t eaten in a day. Who knows what types of food that beast might have in the kitchen? What does a beast eat? Instead of making the long trek back downstairs, you decide just to eat one these fruits.

Which will you eat?
12.title: Lira

121.content:
You dig your teeth into the blue fruit, and pull a chunk into your mouth. "BLECH!" you yell. It's completely dried out. You decide to just drop it and go to the kitchen, but surprisingly, you can't stop eating the blue fruit. Soon, you've swallowed the last bite. Nothing remains but the core.

"NOOOOOOOO!!!!" Roars a voice from the staircase. The beast comes up the stares, and sees the naked core. He comes toward you, but his words fade away, as you pass out.

When you come to, you're outside sitting in the pool of the fountain in the front. It's raining. You see that the front gate is unlocked, and wide open.
121.title: Water

1211.content: You decide it's best to escape while you still have the chance. You might never get to go home again if you don't go now. 12111.content:
Filled with panic, you flop around on the coble stone path. You have a better look. Your legs are completely gone. A tail emerges from the end of your dress instead. You feel different all over, but that's all you can see right now.

The power of that tail is amazing. You try to move your feet, and the tail reacts. The flopping is powerful enough to lift you into the air, so you can come smashing back down to the ground. You need water.

As if by your command, the water from the fountain overflows, and covers you, seeping into your gills, and coating your scales. Sliding on the water, you're carried in through the open doors of the mansion, and fall into a hole filled with water.

You use your tail as if you were walking, and it brings you to the surface just as easily. You grab the edge of the hole dug into the castle's main hall, and stare at the creature, who's holding onto his shovel as he rests. "I ate the fruit labeled "Strength." he says. "I gained unbelievable strength, but became a monster. You are a fruit to control water, and became a creature of the sea. No... Not a creature. A Mermaid." He stares at you for a moment, and looks away. "I didn't want this to happen. I never thought you would go and eat one of those fruits. I won't control you any longer. I only wish to continue my research for a cure." That must have been why he needed money, you think.

Upon closer inspection, a small door was hidden in the room. You go through it to find another room like the last, but with only two fruit stands. The other stand was crimson and contained a bright red, shriveled fruit. The black stand is labeled "Become the Shadows" and the red stand was labeled "Succumb to the Red Thirst."

Your still hungry and want some fruit. Do you eat either of these fruit, or continue through the door?

You cough and black smoke comes out of your mouth. In a panic, you run back to the green room which had a mirror in it. You stare in shock as your reflection changes before your eyes. Your pale blonde hair turns raven black, your skin becomes even paler and gaunt, and the strange reddish color in your eyes vanishes as your entire iris turns black. Black smoke billows around you as you feel a stretching feeling, almost like your becoming taller. Eventually you start to loose conciseness and black out. Although you don't notice, you don't actually fall to the ground; you simply float down.

13.content:
"This way, Dante. Hurry!" Eduard calls to you. "We're almost out." You quickly move through the corridor, not making a sound. The smell of gruel becomes weaker and weaker. You may never have to smell that foul smell again.

When the moonlight finally illuminates your eyes, you fill with joy. However, you're not outside yet. You've only managed to make it to the glass greenhouse on top of the castle. It belongs to the King's on call alchemist, Fevroir. "We shouldn't be here..." you say.

"Why not?" says a voice from behind you. Both you and Eduard freeze. You knew that voice too well. Fevroir. "I'm not going to report the escaped prisoners. That would take away my two latest test subjects, wouldn't it?" You're being blackmailed. Do as he says, or it's back to your cell. Maybe even execution.

Fevroir points to a desk across the greenhouse. On shelves behind it, dozens of black fruits are lined up in small glass cases. Protected from outside harm, as they rest on mahogany pedestals. "Each of you, eat one. Then you may go."

"That's all?" Eduard asks, doubting Fevroir would waste this opportunity with something so... simple.

"Yes. I ask that you rendezvous with myself at a later date so I can see the effects, but that is all for now."

You and Eduard exchange nervous glances. It wouldn't make sense to go through all the effort just to poison them, and he said he wanted to see the "effects" later... (Whatever those might be) You decide it's worth it, and approach the table.

Each fruit is in a glass display case, and there's a tag naming the fruit. Which will you eat?
13.title: Dante

131.content: You lift the glass case and take the fruit from it's pedestal. Holding it in your hand, you can feel the pure evil radiating from within it. If you eat this fruit, you may very well lose yourself to it.
131.title: Dragon

1311.content: You eat the fruit. Before you can even finish, you're overwhelmed with pain. You fall to the ground, and crutch your stomach. "Damn, You..." you say. before passing out.
1311.title: Food Poisoning?

13111.content:
Hours later, you wake up on an uncomfortable bed. You see sunlight coming through the glass. "SHIT!" you yell as you leap up.

"Where are you going?" Fevroir says. "You'll get caught for sure. Wait here until night time, when they stop searching for you."

"What the hell did you do to me, you crazy old man?"

"I gave you a choice which fruit you would eat! YOU chose that fruit! Not I!" Fevroir pulls a mirror out from behind his work bench, and wipes the dust off. You see yourself for the first time.

Your skin is missing. Instead, you're covered from head to toe in blood red scales. Your eyes are huge and bulging, a royal shade of purple. Long blade like claws top your fingers. Terrifying black wings have sprouted from your back. "You Bastard!" you scream. "You turned me into a monster!" Without any abnormal effort, a glowing orange fireball shoots from your mouth at Fevroir.

He slaps it with the back of his hand, and it flies off into the glass roof where it dissolves. After a snap of his fingers, Eduard appears from a black mist. His face shows no emotion. His mind has been wiped out.

"Protect me, my slave!" Fevroir commands your friend.
13111.title: Hours Later

131112.content: You lunge forward, and slash his chest with your claws. It feels so natural. He grabs the arm with his, and holds it tight. His right arm is covered in a black glow, and he punches with it. Your chest crackles, and you cringe. You spit a fireball in his face, but it has no effect. He punches you again. This time, the fist pierces all the way through your chest, poking a hole through.
131112.title: Duel with a friend

1311122.content:
You lose it. For a brief minute, every ounce of humanity drains from your body. You rip the fist from your chest, and keep pulling, until the hand is completely severed from his body. You toss the hand on the ground, you stab your claws through his neck, severing it. The head falls to the ground, and not long after, the body falls too. You don't stop there. You get on the ground, and start ripping chunks of him off, and shoving them into your mouth, swallowing them whole. It's delicious.

When you regain common sense, you see the body half eaten in front of you. You try and feel sorrow for what you just did, but somehow, your mind won't allow you to feel any regret for it. Still, you wonder if you should give your only friend a more peaceful death.
1311122.title: Keep Fighting

choices: Eat the guards. They'll only be a pain in the neck later
13111221.content:
Despite having having no regrets you burn the body of your former friend. As you do do your wounds begin healing. After burning Eduard's corpse you sense something off. It's like a rotten corpse who's stench has been covered up by foul dark magic. Fevroir smiles wickedly as if he expected something.

"It looks like the cat is out of the bag. You're probably wondering what that stench is. You can come out Your Majesty."

King Vaughn walks lifelessly into the room. His eyes showing the same callous look on the day he killed his wife. The stench of death hits your nostrils. How long has the king been undead? Was he like this when you were first thrown in prison?

"What's going on and why does the king smell like he has been dead for seven years?"

Fevroir's smile widens and he starts laughing evilly.

"Are you that dense Dante? Of course he's been dead for seven years. I did kill him and turned him into my slave. Just like your friend."

"What! You'll die right here and now!" You yell as you hurl a fireball at the wicked alchemist.

Vaughn blocks the fireball and starts burning into ashes. Unfortunately for you a few guards witnessed the action.

"Thank heavens you made it. One of the prisoners was holding me hostage and ate one of my fruits I've made. He then transformed into a dragon and started to go on a rampage." Fevroir said as he lied to the guards.

What should I do? They'll never listen to me. Should I escape or should I eat them since they won't listen to reason?
13111221.title: Burn the body

choices: Eat more beef. They are clones afterall
No buld a new home first, eat later
131112211.content:
You decide to leave figuring that slaying all of the guards would become a real bore and uninteresting. You also don't want to kill any more humans. As delicious as they tasted the queasiness in your stomach tells you that humans aren't a healthy option for a dragon such as yourself. You roar at the guards before taking flight. Hopefully that should tell them not to mess with you. You need a plan on how to expose Fevroir, but no one would believe you whether human or dragon. As you soar you feel your long brown mane flow in the wind. You quickly spot a pasture full of cows.

"Might as well get something to eat." You say to yourself as you swoop down and roast a few cows.

You greedily devour the cows and savor their taste. As you finished your last cow you see a terrified woman staring at you. Oddly she doesn't scream or run away.

"Who are you? I've never seen a dragon with such remarkable features." The woman gasps as she does a double take of your draconic form.

"The name's Dante. I used to be human, but was turned into a dragon after I ate an alchemist's cursed fruit."

"Dante... That's a mighty name for both a man and a dragon."

"Why aren't you cowering in fear?" You ask the woman.

"The truth is I've been studying science and magic. The cows you just ate were clones I released from the lab."

"Is that so? Listen lady I just escaped from one mad scientist and I don't intend on being experimented on again."

"Don't worry Dante, I have studied everything this is regarding dragons. If you would like there is an abandoned mine not too far from here."

"I could use a place to lay low."

"Sweet! Would you like a few more cows to eat before you go? I muscular dragon such as yourself must still be hungry. So what will it be?"
131112211.title: Escape

1312.content:
Eduard eats his fruit, and you drop yours into your pants, making sure Fevroir can't see. You pretend to chew, and swallow something.

"Over here," beckons the sly old fox. "You didn't eat it, did you?" Before you have a chance to lie or confess, he holds his palm to your face, and a torrent of lightning rushes through you, until you drop to the ground.

"Dante!" Eduards screams. He grabs Fevroir's wrist, and he becomes still. Slowly, his skin and clothes become gray. Before long, Fevroir has become a stone statue, forever lunging out with his old decrepit fingers.

"All I did was... Touch him..." Eduard says. He sits on the ground, staring at his hands. He must have eaten the "Stone" fruit. Somehow, he's been given the power of stone.

Fevroir's statue stands in front of you.
1312.title: Hide it

13121.content:
You charge forward, and tackle the statue. It breaks into a thousand pieces on the floor, and spells out the end of the Kingdom's number one Alchemist. "Let's go."

Eduard recovers from the shock, and runs to the table. He takes a sack, and starts loading the fruits into it. When he has all of them, you both sprint for the exit.

131211.content:
Meters from the main gate, your clean escape is cut short. "I thought you were better than that, Dante." says Captain Dupree. He stands firm with his arms crossed in your way. "I even tried to have you acquitted, because I knew you were innocent. Then you break out, and commit murder."

'How did he know?' you wonder. You and Eduard had just killed Fevroir moments ago.

Eduard holds up a fist to Captain Dupree. "Shall I take care of him, Dante?"
131211.title: Continue

1312112.content: "Allow me," you say. You've seen the power of these fruits, and you want that. Plus you used to spar with Dupree frequently. You haven't forgotten him fighting style at all. You reach into your pants, and pull the "Dragon" fruit. Eduard has a bag loaded with fruit as well. Which will you eat?
1312112.title: Reunion Duel

13121122.content:
"Shit," you cuss, "None of them are marked! What the hell will I be eating?"

"The tags were mounted to the shelves. there was no time to take them and stick them to the fruits."

You just suck it up, and bite into one. "I don't know what you're doing, but I'm not going to Let you do it!" Dupree says, as he charges you with his sword drawn.
13121122.title: Unmarked

131211221.content:
Beneath his swing, you slam your fists into his chest. They bounce off his armored plate, and do nothing. The next slash of his sword cuts through your stomach.

"What the hell are you?!" he coughs out, as he turns around and sprints. Eduard runs too. Looking down, you see black tentacles coming from the wound. Slowly, you're becoming taller and taller. Your body loses it's shape and becomes a gray mass of rotten flesh. You become taller and taller. Your arms get longer, and become clawed. Seven extras emerge from your body. Your legs are gone, and in their place are twelve tentacles. Suction cups and all. As your head swells up into gray matter, eyes sprout all over your head, giving you a 360 degree field of vision. All color vanishes, and the world becomes gray.

You've become a monster. A true monster.
131211221.title: What I've Become

135332121.content:
When Fevroir saw that you two had finally choose to eat a fruit to eat, he walked over to a painting and reviled a hidden path way. “Follow this path out of the castle, and good luck.”

With that You and Edward run through the path with all your might. You figured that the changes to your bodies would take a while and you hoped that you would be far enough away from the castle before the guards come to kill the two of you.

As you run through the cave, you ask Edward, “So when you are free what are your plans?”

Edward is silent for a moment before he replies, “Dante, do you know why I was locked up?”

“Not really.” You state as you begin to worry about what he might have done.”

With a sigh Edward said “Before I was captored, I was a pirate.”

That surpraised you. You had always figured that Edward had done something bad, but the idea that he was a pirate, not something you could believe. You were about to ask him something else when you saw light at the end of the tunnel.

The two of you were free at last.

Or so you thought looking around you relieze that you are still very close to the castle.

Edward then says, “Come on we have to get away from here as fast as we can.”

And with that the odd pair, a knight and a pirate, worked together to get as far away from the castle as they could.

They were only able to run for 3 hours when they both felt a horrible pain in there stomachs. Before they could do anything both of them fell unconscious

----------------- -------------------------- ----------------------- ----------------

Next Day—In a forest near a village. (5 miles away from the castle)

It was morrning when you(Dante) woke up, the pain was gone and to your surprise, so was Edward. You immediately start to call for him. When you hear a reply from behind some trees you go to check up on him.

“WHAT THE HELL!” You scream as you see a giant _______

153.title: New Choices.

1532.content:
Sirius sighed and got out of bed. Yet again, he had woken in his house at the edge of town. Not as if he expected anything else, but it was always depressing to find himself in this place, all alone. He sighed and stood up, getting changed and walking to the forest. The forest was one of his favorite places, seeing as no one ever went there and it was quiet enough for him to think, imagining the life he could have had if he had been a little less ominous looking. He sighed, coming to his favorite spot and leaned against the trunk of a tall tree. He closed his eyes and smiled, thinking up, yet again, the life of his dreams. He saw himself, slicing the head of a powerful knight in black armor off in one swing and saving a beautiful princess. He saw her smile, kiss him and hug him, thanking him for his help. They went to her room, receiving cheers all the way. In her room, he smiled at her and she did the same to him, both slowly climbing closer in bed, until fin-
He jumped as he heard a noise, opening his eyes and looking around. He saw nothing, and was about to close his eyes and get on with his fantasies when he noticed a solid silver bowl in front of him, containing fruits with small notes attached to their surface. He looked at them enviously. They looked good, better than anything he had ever had before. Finally, his sense of greed overcame his kindness and he shouted for anyone in the area to hear:
"Whoever gave me these fruits, thank you!" He reached down, grabbing a fruit in each hand and looking down at their labels.
1532.title: A not so normal, very special, day in the forest.

15321.content:
He swallowed the last bite, then fell to his knees, screaming in pain. It felt like his entire body was covered in flames! He screamed again, looking around. He vaguely saw the black forms of people, almost as if they were shadows. He saw them speaking, but while he couldn't hear what they were saying, they seemed to be referring to him and the fruit. He screamed a third time, this time making the shadowy figures jump and rush over. He thought they were going to help, yet all they did was grab the fruit and the bowl, shouting silently to one another and running away as quickly as possible, fruit bowl in hand. Only one stayed, a girl of about fourteen. The shadow girl seemed to take pity, walking over and placing a mirror in front of him without a sound. She turned, apparently having heard something, and ran after the others. Sirius screamed a fourth and final time, falling face first to the soft forest floor.

---------------------------------------------------------------

Sirius opened his eyes, looking around. He was laying in the forest, his head throbbing and his back aching. He moaned and stretched, looking at the world through one eye...
...and finding his other eye giving a similar, albeit very shadowy, image. He gasped, feeling something, or rather two somethings, move on his back. He looked back, not sure if he wanted to know what the things were, to find two black, bat like wings. He could feel that his teeth were sharp like fangs, and he had a long tail that resembled the tail of a scorpion. His skin was a dark red, almost black, and he saw his demonic features easily in the mirror. His left eye was black, the whites of the eye having become orange like flames and the center of the eye a bright red. He had a long, curved, bone white horn on the right side of his head, right above his green eye. He screamed, the sound like rough metal scraping and he heard the sound echo in the forest, where it shouldn't have, followed closely by screaming.
"No, I can't have been that loud!" He gasped as he ran home, planning to grab what he could before the townspeople came looking.

---------------------------------------------------------------

He had grabbed a cloak, some food, his notebook, a few pencils, some ink, a quill, and some water. He looked around for anything else, and his eyes aligned on the note from his parents, the only memento he had of them. He grabbed it and put it in the back of his notebook and ran for the door even as he heard the mob of angry townspeople arrive. He stopped, put on the cloak, put the notebook and writing tools into the hidden pocket he had found in the back of the cloak, and left. He walked into a crowd of frightened and determined townspeople.
"Sirius, do you know what caused that unearthly screech earlier?" The mayor, Kyle, asked. Kyle was strong, tall, and noble, what every boy in the town aspired to. He had a tremendous hatred of anything unholy after his mother was killed by a demon.
"No, I have no idea." Sirius responded in a voice that he barely recognized as his own. It was deep, rough, and had an unmistakable evil to it. Unlike the rest of the villagers, Kyle seemed to notice.
"Hey Sirius, what's wrong with your voice?" Now that he mentioned it, most of the villagers noticed as well.
"Why are you wearing a hood? You always said you hate hiding your face." One of the villagers said, reminding everyone of the fact and convincing Kyle that you were hiding something.
"Sirius, pull down the hood." He said, reaching for the hood of the cloak. Sirius backed out of reach and responded with a simple no.
"Why not? What are you hiding?" Kyle asked, sending a wave through the crowd.
"I'm not hiding anything." By this point, no one could hear him, and someone managed to get behind him and pull down the hood. The entire clearing silenced instantly as everyone got a good look at Sirius's new face. Kyle seemed particularly unhappy, his normally peaceful and kind features twisted into the most hideous scowl Sirius had ever seen. Finally, Kyle spoke.
"Kill the Demon!" The cry was taken up by every person in the crowd, spreading and becoming louder every second. Sirius turned and ran just as the crowd surged forward. He ran for the forest, sure no one would follow. Unfortunately, nearly everyone was caught up in the excitement and anger of the chase and simply ignored the trees and lush foliage. Sirius ran as fast as he could, wings and tail trailing behind him. He felt someone dive and grab his tail, slowing him enough for the others to catch up and grab him. Kyle walked up and stood barely a step away, looking Sirius in the eyes, green and red alike.
"We will not tolerate demons among us!" He yelled to the crowd, electing cheers.
"We will not allow the demon to hurt innocent citizens!" The crowd shouts increased in volume.
"We will kill the demon, using whatever methods we need!" The shouting reached a peak, hitting pitches that no one in the group but the newly transformed Sirius could hear. The people reached for Sirius, trying with all their might to tear him in half.
He screamed with rage, fear, sadness, pain, and more, putting all his strength into staying together. He felt the hundreds of people beginning to, quite literally, tear him in half. He reached deep inside himself for some kind of deep reserve of energy, sure he would find nothing and die by the hands of people he had once known.
Yet he did find the strength and, shouting with determination above the screams of the crowd, pulled in with his arms, his legs, his wings, and his tail. The people tugging on his limbs screamed in terror as they were pulled off the ground and slammed into one another, many falling unconscious and the rest too stunned to stand. Sirius bellowed with all the air in his lungs, releasing a horrible sound somewhere between an animal growling, a human screaming, and metal being scraped with a second piece of metal. Many people collapsed in pain, the noise literally scratching their eardrums. Those who remained standing ran, leaving more people than Sirius could count laying on the ground, unconscious. Kyle was the only one still standing, his face red with pain and anger, his blade raised. The sword was a beautiful thing, a mixture of holy silver and the hardest steel in the land, it could seriously hurt any unholy being it touched, even with only the slightest touch. It was called Silverfang, and was the most powerful holy sword in the land. Sirius turned and ran a second time, trying to escape to the cave that all the people seemed to think contained some sort of monster. He had gone inside countless times, memorizing the tunnels and searching for this so called monster. He had never found anything, but perhaps he could lose Kyle in the tunnel systems. He reached the entrance and dived inside, barely avoiding a deadly sweep of Silverfang as it whizzed through the air. The blade smashed against the tunnel wall, knocking loose a small avalanche of pebbles. Sirius ducked under a second swing of the silver sword and tackled Kyle, pinning him to the ground and knocking his blade out of reach outside the tunnel.
"Why can't you just leave me alone?" Sirius shouted, a tear in his human eye, a spark in his other. Kyle glared up at Sirius and punched him in the face, hurting his own hand.
"Because you are a horrible, unholy creature! My mother died to one of your kind, and I will never allow that to happen to someone else!" He reached up and grabbed Sirius's horn, pulling hard. It felt as if he were about to loose his horn! He growled an animalistic growl and pushed Kyle back, scraping the man's back on the rough stone of the cave. He backed deeper into the cave as Kyle grabbed his sword.
"What have I ever done?! Nothing!" Sirius dodged to the side, barely avoiding Kyle's murderous overhand swing. Kyle shot him a look of pure hate.
"But you will do something!" He screeched, swinging his sword and barely missing Sirius yet again. "Your demon blood will compel you!"
"I only gained demon blood today, and that was by mistake!" Sirius jumped over Kyle's sweep and hit Kyle's hand with his palm, forcing the hand open and causing the sword to fly across the room, embedding in a wall. Kyle dived and rolled, standing and pulling the sword with all his might, yet it didn't budge. He growled and pulled his steel dagger from his hip, swinging at Sirius. Sirius dodged blow after blow, the moves fast and perfect. If anyone had seen the fight, it may have been described 'as fluid as any dance', yet no one was watching. Eventually, Sirius did a back flip, knocking Kyle's dagger out of his hands with his feet and stopping next to Silverfang. He grabbed it in both hands by the leather handle and pulled, grunting with the effort. Finally, the blade came free and Sirius pointed it straight at Kyle, who froze.
"Just leave me be!" Kyle then proceeded to do something Sirius would have thought insane: he grabbed the sword by the blade and pulled it out of Sirius's hands. He flipped it around, brandishing it expertly.
"The blade doesn't cut the skin of a holy being." Sirius narrowed his eyes.
"But you are getting tired, and I'm not, probably because of my new demon blood. Face it, I was a better fighter as a human, and I'm doubly so as a half human. You can't win." Kyle growled angrily.
"I may not be able to kill you, but I can bury you!" And he turned, running to the exit and slashing at the walls with his blade as he went. Sirius began to follow, but the tunnel collapsed before him, trapping him inside and Kyle out. Sirius sighed deeply. He would be left alone, probably until the end of his days. He walked back, moving to the deepest part of the caves, and lay down on the rocky ground. He ate the food he had packed and drank the water, then began writing in his journal. Eventually, he lay down the journal and went to sleep.

Choice 1: Choice 1: Many years pass, Sirius only conscious enough to write in his journal on occasion, his demon blood giving him extremely long life and no need for food or water. He remains mostly asleep until he meets a girl named Myra.

Choice 2: Reader's Choice.
15321.title: "Demonic"

153211.content:
Hundreds of years have passed in what seems like a month. Thanks to the gift, or maybe it's a curse?, you don't need any water food or oxygen to live. Now you are so used to being in this body, that you are a master in the skills, abilities, and difference things you can do in this body. You have lived in this sightless world for so long, you don't remember what light looks like.


One day, you have awoken to write in your journal to mark off the amount of years you have been in here. You wake up from your death-like trance every 100 years to mark down every century.

Today's different. As you are about to go back to sleep, you see a bright beam of hot piercing light hit you. In panic, you turn invisible, one of your many skills. You are so scared you remain that way until night. You are so excited, you start a new journal entry:

Date= ?/??/????
"My tunnel that was sealed off so long ago, in 1294, has now been reopened thanks to the local people. I wonder what the world looks like now? It is night so I am about to go out and exc-" A mysterious girl came up to you and surprised you. When you ask her her name,she says she's Myra. She then asks you to follow her, in a very adult, formal manner, and you are wondering some things, first, how she can see you, you are still invisible, and also, you wonder why she isn't running away from you right now. When you ask her that, she responds that you are the Malachi, the half demon that is either destined to destroy the world or to become its hero. When you ask her how she knows this, she says you will have to find out. She asks you to follow her, should you or should you discover things about the new world by yourself

info.brief_description: You eat a piece of magical fruit that grants you powers you never imagined.
info.description:
One day, you come across a magical piece of fruit that grants you special powers unique to those who have eaten the fruit. You may use the powers to do as you like, as long as you keep the rules in mind.


Rules
1. Keep it clean. No sex scenes. Sex may occur, but you may not go into explicit detail. (This isn't erotica)
2. One Fruit per character. We don't want the protagonist to become too powerful. If you'd like to discuss the possibility of a second fruit on a character, send me a message. (mid-knight@writing.com) If that branch isn't at least 20 chapters long, don't bother asking. It's already a No.
3. Keep Characters consistent within their own story. The character can develop differently as the story progresses, but radical changes shouldn't occur in a single chapter.
4. Try to make the choices at the end of each chapter a choice that the character could make, as opposed to something that happens. The choices can be really simple, but within each chapter, you could bring the story in an entirely different direction.
5. Be Creative, and Have Fun



First 50 Chapters Earn GP Rewards
